results.title: Scotland: land of legends
results.creator_credit: International Video Network, Susan Templin, Peter May and Chip Duncan
results.brief_description: Narrated by John McIlwraith this video provides the viewer with an armchair guide of Scotland, land of legends. Explore the history of golf, visit Glasgow, the Barras, the rugged landscape of the Hebrides, Aberdeen, the River Tweed, Glenfiddich Distillery, Loch Ness, Urquhart Castle, and Dryburgh Abbey, resting place of Sir Walter Scott.
results.creator_credit_for_label: International Video Network, Susan Templin, Peter May and Chip Duncan

results.title: Scotland: background of literature
results.brief_description: The battlefields of the Border Country, the Lowlands and the rugged Highlands of Scotland have provided the inspiration for the works of Robert Burns, Walter Scott, Stevenson, Defoe and others. Picturing scenes from these various parts of Scotland, the film provides a background for the study and appreciation of the stories and poems of Scottish writers.

results.title: Scotland Yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Aspects of the work of Scotland Yard detectives are illustrated in an accident following a warehouse robbery and how the various Yard departments and other police departments work in cooperation. Traces the case through from the stealing of a car carrying a load of tea to the conviction of the criminals involved in it. Briefly shows the various methods of identification, namely, by fingerprint, by photograph, and on parade in front of a witness.

results.title: Scorsese x 4: four short films by Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: What’s a nice girl like you doing in a place like this?(USA, 1963, 9m) Scorsese’s first student production which was filmed on a shoestring budget and shows the influence of Fellini, Godard and Truffaut on the budding director. “It’s not just you, Murray!”(USA, 1964, 15m) combines the look of Italian cinema with the gangster film and is a definite step towards Scorsese’s later feature, “Mean Streets”(1973). “The Big Shave”(USA, 1967, 6m) was conceived as a protest against the Vietnam War and remains as one of his most enigmatic films. It went on to win the Prix L’Age d’Or at Ledoux’s Knokke Festival. “Italianamerican”(USA, 1974, 45m) belongs to a later phase of Scorsese’s career and is a highly personal and affectionate portrait of life in America through the eyes of his parents Charles and Catherine. It was financed by an NEH Bicentennial Award intended to encourage documentation of America’s immigrant communities, it was shot in the Scorsese family apartment on Elizabeth Street New York.

results.title: Scoring: a story about date rape
results.creator_credit: Coronet, Lisa Levy Stromer and William R Sheridan
results.brief_description: Notions of what constitutes rape are explored in this documentary aimed at secondary school students. This is achieved through the story of Jimmy, a teenage boy who commits rape but can’t see it. His relationship is contrasted with a positive role model who doesn’t use coersion to get what he wants. The issues explored in the drama include; how a woman dresses, what constitues consent, what’s involved in accepting a date, and legal repurcussions.

results.title: Score
results.brief_description: Soft-pornography/erotica from director Radley Metzger resplendent with witty dialogue, telephone repairman and funky music. Older married couple Elvira and Jack like to ‘swing’ and indulge frequently in sex parties with strangers or other couples. Betsy and Eddy are younger, naive newlyweds that become the latest object of desire for Elvira and Jack and the game is on to see who will win their conquest first. Eventually, Elvira and Betsy then Jack and Eddy form up to get high and get busy. A fantasy romp that includes dressing-up, drugs and mirrors. Cast includes Claire Wilbur, Calvin Culver, Lynn Lowry, Gerald Grant, Carl Parker.

results.title: ScooterZ: basics and beyond
results.brief_description: Presented by Eric Wiley, this short program with an energetic soundtrack shows beginners and advanced riders enjoying their ScooterZ - a mode of transport originating in Asia that has taken the world by storm. Everything from young boys getting about town, Razer Pro Team Riders, Go-PED Pro Team Riders and professional rollerbladers, in line skaters and other extreme forms of “board” sports. NB: This is not an instructional video, and not all riders wear helmets and knee pads. Rather it shows the possibilities of ScooterZ and the progression from skate boards to in line skating to ScooterZ and beyond.
